derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 18th cent.: from French postulant or Latin postulant- 'asking', from the verb postulare (see postulate)

means.word_mean: 1. one submitting a request or application especially one seeking admission into a religious order

auth_sentence.content: If satisfied, the officiating abbot admits the postulant.

auth_sentence.content: To become a Theravadin monk a postulant shaves his head and beard and adopts the yellow robes of the monk.
